greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of parts if 4^n is partitioned into parts of size 3^n as far as possible into parts of size 2^n as far as possible and into parts of size 1^n.
comment: Corresponds to the only solution of the Diophantine equation 4^n = x*3^n + y*2^n + z*1^n with constraints 0 <= y < 3^n/2^n, 0 <= z < 2^n.
Binary order (cf. A029837) of a(n) is close to n.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..250
program: (PARI) { f=t=w=1; for (n=1, 250, f*=4; t*=3; w*=2; a=divrem(f, t); b=divrem(a[2], w); write("b064630.txt", n, " ", a[1]+b[1]+b[2]) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Sep 20 2009
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Oct 01 2001
